text: There are two main types of breast cancer. Breast tumors may have a single type of cancer, a combination of types, or a mixture of invasive and noninvasive (in situ) cancer.

Ductal carcinoma (cancer) is the most common form of breast cancer. Tumors form in the cells of the milk ducts, which carry milk to the nipples. Ductal carcinoma can be invasive with the potential to spread or non-invasive (also called ductal carcinoma in situ or DCIS). About one in five new breast cancer cases are DCIS. The chance for successful treatment of DCIS usually is very high.

Lobular carcinoma (cancer) occurs in the lobules, which are the milk-producing glands. Lobular breast cancer can be non-invasive (in situ or LCIS, also called lobular neoplasia) or invasive (have a tendency to spread). About one in 10 breast cancer cases are invasive lobular cancer.

content-right.title: DID YOU KNOW?
content-right.text: 192,370+ women are diagnosed with breast cancer annually.

text: The correct diagnosis is crucial in choosing the best treatment. Our pathologists bring a remarkable level of skill and experience to each patient diagnosis. This helps our experts tailor the most effective treatment for you.
There are several types of biopsies used by MD Anderson to detect and stage breast cancersâ€¦

text: In breast reconstruction surgery, a plastic surgeon recreates all or part of a breast that has been surgically removed. This is done using a breast implant, or tissue from another part of the body. The goal of reconstruction is to make breasts look natural and balanced when the patient is wearing clothing.
Candidates for breast reconstruction include women who have been:
list: Diagnosed with breast cancer and had or will have a mastectomy (surgical removal of a breast)
Diagnosed with breast cancer and had or will have breast conservation surgery, such as partial mastectomy or lumpectomy (surgical removal of the tumor and surrounding breast tissue)
Found to have a genetic mutation and will have prophylactic mastectomy (removal of non-cancerous breast to prevent cancer)

content-right.title: DID YOU KNOW?
content-right.text: 192,370+ women are diagnosed with breast cancer.

text: Breast cancer is the most common cancer in women and is second only to lung cancer as the leading cause of cancer deaths among women in the United States. It affects one of every eight American women.
More than 192,370 women are diagnosed with breast cancer each year, and the number of new cases has declined over the past decade. More than 40,000 women lose their lives to this disease every year.
Men can develop breast cancer, but it happens much less often than in women. Nearly 2,000 men are diagnosed with breast cancer each year.

content-right.title: DID YOU KNOW?

text: There are 2 parts to this study: dose escalation and dose expansion. This consent form is for the dose expansion part of this study only. The goal of the dose escalation part of this study was to find the highest tolerable dose of ABT-414, either alone or in combination with temozolomide, that could be given to patients with glioblastoma. This dose has been found.
